name: GraphDefinition
description: A formal computable definition of a graph of resources - that is, a coherent set of resources that form a graph by following references. The Graph Definition resource defines a set and makes rules about the set.

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: url
elements.short: Canonical identifier for this graph definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
elements.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this graph definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this graph definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the graph definition is stored on different servers.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: version
elements.short: Business version of the graph definition
elements.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the graph definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the graph definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: name
elements.short: Name for this graph definition (computer friendly)
elements.description: A natural language name identifying the graph definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.description: The status of this graph definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: experimental
elements.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
elements.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this graph definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: date
elements.description: The date  (and optionally time) when the graph definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the graph definition changes.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: publisher
elements.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
elements.description: The name of the organization or individual that published the graph definition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contact
elements.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.short: Natural language description of the graph definition
elements.description: A free text natural language description of the graph definition from a consumer's perspective.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: useContext
elements.short: The context that the content is intended to support
elements.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate graph definition instances.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: jurisdiction
elements.short: Intended jurisdiction for graph definition (if applicable)
elements.description: A legal or geographic region in which the graph definition is intended to be used.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: purpose
elements.short: Why this graph definition is defined
elements.description: Explanation of why this graph definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: start
elements.short: Type of resource at which the graph starts
elements.description: The type of FHIR resource at which instances of this graph start.

binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: profile
elements.description: The profile that describes the use of the base resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: link
elements.short: Links this graph makes rules about
elements.description: Links this graph makes rules about.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: path
elements.short: Path in the resource that contains the link
elements.description: A FHIR expression that identifies one of FHIR References to other resources.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: sliceName
elements.description: Which slice (if profiled).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: min
elements.description: Minimum occurrences for this link.

elements.name: max
elements.description: Maximum occurrences for this link.

elements.name: description
elements.description: Information about why this link is of interest in this graph definition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: target
elements.description: Potential target for the link.

elements.name: use
elements.description: Defines how the compartment rule is used - whether it it is used to test whether resources are subject to the rule, or whether it is a rule that must be followed.

binding.description: Defines how a compartment rule is used.

elements.description: identical | matching | different | no-rule | custom.
